page.title: 10FARMING.
page.content: Almost all farms are tenanted from the Spencer estate which has ten farms leased in the area.There are some small holdings on what was Glebe land.These are privately owned.There is also a garden centre. The average size of field is between 20 and 40 acres.Grazing land accounts for roughly a third of all acreage.The remainder being given over to wheat, barley and oil seed rape.No field within the perimeter of Harlestone is ploughed. Although sheep and beef cattle are commonplace there is only one dairy herd of seventy cows which produces 5,000 litres of milk a year. Most sheep are sheared by contractor but a villager in Harlestone shears small numbers.There are at least two sheep dips within the survey area.
